page.title: 17Local History
page.content: Chancellor of England and founder of Wye College of Secular Priests was born. After the Kempes the house was lived in by the Thornhills, Royalists in the Civil War. Lady Joanna Thornhill is still remembered in Wye as the benefactor of the primary school. The next owners till this century were the Sawbridges who after the house caught fire in the late nineteenth century moved to Bilting House. The early members of this family were somewhat eccentric. One was associated with the South Sea Bubble and various members of the family represented Canterbury at Parliament. Throughout this century the house has been occupied by the Loudon family. Mr. F.W.H. Loudon was high sheriff of Kent in 1969 and died in August 1985. His son, Mr. James Loudon lives there now.
